channel.title: MarkVopat tweets

item.description: @StackSocial apparently your company doesnâ€™t understand what â€œUnsubscribeâ€ means. I will continue to delete all your unwanted emails, and encourage others to never sign up for them in the first place.

Can someone tell me how to change the header image in Drummer? I canâ€™t seem to figure out how to access the <head>.
@jesflres 2 of the 3 triple vaxxed in my house didn't get COVID, while 1 early triple vaxxed and 1 not triple vaxxed did get it.
Mandatory masking in schools reduced COVID-19 cases https://t.co/pniOt1oaDR
It is incredibly confusing out there as to how we should be viewing the current state of the pandemic. Some consistent national leadership would be nice: https://t.co/wRCrGf60hw
Wordle 277 3/6 â¬›â¬›ğŸŸ¨â¬›ğŸŸ© ğŸŸ¨â¬›â¬›ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ© ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©

@sage_edwards If it was my health only, then probably not. But, if I consider the immunocompromised on campus, in my personal life, and the very young children I may be in contact with, then no it may not be sufficient. Regardless, the next few weeks will determine if this was a prudent policy
@BodyofBreen Iâ€™m so hoping youâ€™re wrong, but afraid you might be right. I suspect we will know in the next few weeks.

@sage_edwards I never claimed they were. I will continue to wear one, though it will be be less effective in an enclosed space for an hour an 15 minutes without social distancing and with unmasked students.
Grrr Wordle 276 6/6 â¬›â¬›â¬›ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨ ğŸŸ¨â¬›ğŸŸ¨â¬›â¬› â¬›ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¨â¬›ğŸŸ¨ ğŸŸ©â¬›ğŸŸ©â¬›ğŸŸ¨ ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©â¬›â¬› ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©ğŸŸ©
@leonblum I did the same thing last semester, but I may have to do the same thing myselfâ€”weather permitting.
We can and need to do better than this https://t.co/a689TFP3pr

1/5 YSU has decided to end its mask mandate entirely. I would feel better about this decision if the decision was based upon how many of our students have been vaccinated, but of course, YSU does not even require faculty, staff, or students to report their vaccination status.
2/5 We are all about "data driven" decision making until it becomes inconvenient to collect that data (or it might give us information we do not like). Right now only 27% of those ages 0-19, and only 50% of those 20-29 in Ohio are fully vaccinated (2-doses).
3/5 The numbers drop more dramatically when you look at those same age groups that are eligible forâ€”and have receivedâ€”a third shot. Apparently, we are just going to cross our fingers and hope that we don't see a BA.2 surge that appears to be happening in Europe
4/5 https://t.co/g1mF4Qx10d
5/5 Fingers crossed; the next few weeks are going to be interesting.
@b_honacki https://t.co/fHOQNJrGYA

If you want a way to easily compose long Twitter threads check out https://t.co/fStsZKiE7X a great free service by RSS creator @davewiner. It now has a place on my web browser's favorites bar.

@MikeOkuda Born in the early 70s; most of Ohio's Republican governors were more fiscally conservative and socially indifferent/liberal. Seems to me they were more libertarian in their social outlook (though maybe my memory is faulty). I don't recognize contemporary Republicans.
Spring https://t.co/yP5pRP0HRa
